heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 13 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.9°C), outside temperature (down 2.6°C), and inside temperature (down 1.8°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 215 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 349 m) and inside temperature (up 2.4°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 215.5m lower than yesterday, 12.8m higher than the past week, 349.4m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 1039m to 2260m and averaged 1250.8m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; cool or mild temperatures. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and winds will be practically absent. Showers, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and it’s dim outside. Similar weather conditions should remain.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
